byline.docAuthor: David Glay, Tuami Lasri, Ahmed Mamouni, Yves Leroy

byline.affiliation:
Institut d'Electronique et de Micro-électronique du Nord, UMR CNRS 8520
IEMN-DHS,

front.address: Avenue Poincaré -B.P. 69 59652 Villeneuve d'Ascq Cedex FRANCE
front.div:
ABSTRACT. Microwave systems for non-contact moisture sensing applications have been
developed. These instruments operate in a very narrow band (around 2.45 GHz or 10 GHz)
and measure the reflection coefficient and / or the transmission coefficient, in magnitude and
phase, of the moist material for determining its dielectric properties. Different investigations
have been carried out in various fields. In this paper, we present a study devoted to the
retrieval of the moisture profile of a building material presenting a non-uniform moisture
distribution.
front.keyword: Keywords : moisture, profile, free space, microwave
